aws::graph::propositions: # Helicopter Maintenance and Inspection Records
Revenue for the company was $40M.
Profit for the company was $12M.
Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the company was $1.25.
Cash provided by operating activities in 2021 was $46,327.
Cash provided by operating activities in 2022 was $46,752.
Cash used in investing activities in 2021 was $58,154.
Cash used in investing activities in 2022 was $37,601.
Cash provided by financing activities in 2021 was $6,291.
Cash provided by financing activities in 2022 was $9,718.
The incident helicopter was located at Airbus Helicopters' facility in Columbus, Mississippi on March 27, 2019.
The incident helicopter was undergoing final assembly and production completion on March 27, 2019.
Airbus Helicopters performed all inspections unless otherwise specified.
The AS350 B3 master servicing manual required a visual inspection of the hydraulic pump pulley bearing.
The AS350 B3 master servicing manual required a check of the drive belt tension.
The main gearbox assembly was removed on June 20, 2019.
The aircraft total time (ATT) was 3.3 hours on June 20, 2019.
The main gearbox assembly was replaced due to suspected contamination.
The replacement main gearbox assembly included the incident HYD2 pump and pulley bearing.
All components in the replacement main gearbox assembly were new.
Multiple inspections were performed on October 24, 2019.
The aircraft total time (ATT) was 3.3 hours on October 24, 2019.
The 12-month/150-flight hour visual inspection of the hydraulic pump belt and pulley bearing was performed on October 24, 2019.
No discrepancies were noted for the hydraulic pump belt and pulley bearing during the October 24, 2019 inspection.
A functional check flight was performed on November 4, 2019.
Several items were noted in a discrepancy/task sheet after the functional check flight.
One entry in the discrepancy/task sheet was to wipe hydraulic pump grease from the transmission deck.
One entry in the discrepancy/task sheet was to wipe hydraulic pump grease from the right-side cowling.
One entry in the discrepancy/task sheet was to wipe hydraulic pump grease from the main gearbox coupling.
The grease wiping task was completed on November 5, 2019.
The helicopter had an aircraft total time (ATT) of 5.3 hours at the conclusion of the functional check flight.
The incident helicopter was flown to Airbus Helicopters' facility in Grand Prairie, Texas in mid-November of 2019.
Airbus Helicopters is a helicopter manufacturer.
Columbus, Mississippi is a location of an Airbus Helicopters facility.
Grand Prairie, Texas is a location of an Airbus Helicopters facility.

text:
# Annual Report

## Financial Highlights

* Revenue: $40M
* Profit: $12M
* EPS: $1.25

| | Year Ended December 31, | |
| | 2021 | 2022 |
|-|-|-|
| Cash provided by (used in): | | |
| Operating activities | $ 46,327 | $ 46,752 |
| Investing activities | (58,154) | (37,601) |
| Financing activities | 6,291 | 9,718 |

According to maintenance records, on March 27, 2019, the incident helicopter was located at Airbus Helicopters' facility in Columbus, Mississippi undergoing final assembly and production completion. All inspections discussed in this section were performed by Airbus Helicopters unless otherwise specified. According to the AS350 B3 master servicing manual, the 12-month/150-flight hour inspection required a visual inspection of the hydraulic pump pulley bearing and a check of the drive belt tension.

On June 20, 2019, at an aircraft total time (ATT) of 3.3 hours, the main gearbox assembly, including attached components such as the hydraulic pump assembly, was removed and replaced due to suspected contamination. A replacement main gearbox assembly, which included the incident HYD2 pump and pulley bearing, was installed. All components in the replacement main gearbox assembly were new. On October 24, 2019 at an ATT of 3.3 hours, multiple inspections were performed, including the 12-month/150-flight hour visual inspection of the hydraulic pump belt and pulley bearing. No discrepancies were noted for the hydraulic pump belt and pulley bearing. On November 4,2019, a functional check flight was performed, after which several items were noted in a discrepancy/task sheet, including an entry to wipe hydraulic pump grease from the transmission deck, the right-side cowling, and the main gearbox coupling, which was completed the next day. The helicopter had an ATT of 5.3 hours at the conclusion of the functional check flight.

The incident helicopter was subsequently flown to Airbus Helicopters' facility in Grand Prairie, Texas in mid-November of 2019.
